item.title: Mario Kart Rider Lit A Joint When The Attraction Broke Down
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you've ever been on a ride at any of the major theme parks, then you should know that they can and will break at the most inopportune times. But at least one guest at Universal Studios' Super Nintendo World took full advantage of the Mario Kart ride's breakdown by lighting up a joint.

The Universal High account on X (via WDWNT), posted a video online of a guest riding the Mario Kart: Bowser's Challenge attraction during a stoppage. And as seen in the clip below, the guest lights up and smokes a little weed while waiting for the ride to resume.

Universal High was quick to point out that the video was first posted by someone else on Instagram, but that original video appears to have been removed. The currently unidentified fan does have some distinctive tattoos on his hand and thumb. But it's unclear if the individual was spotted by any of the park's employees or removed for lighting the joint.

Earlier this year, Universal Orland's new theme park, Epic Universe, opened up an expanded Super Nintendo World. Two of the latest attractions include Donkey Kong's Mine-Cart Madness and Yoshi Adventurer, as well as new things to find with the Power Up Bands worn by guests in the park.

Epic Universe also features four other new areas to explore, including Celestial Park, Wizarding World of Harry Potter: Ministry of Magic, Dark Universe, and How to Train Your Dragon-Isle of Berk.

item.title: Frostpunk 2 Console Edition Preorder Are Now Live
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

After launching on PC last year, the post-apocalyptic, city-building strategy game Frostpunk 2 is making the jump to PS5 and Xbox Series X|S on September 18. If you're interested in adding a physical PS5 or Xbox copy to your collection, you can preorder the game now at multiple online retailers. There are currently no preorder bonuses for Frostpunk 2, but you'll find two physical editions up for grabs--including a $50 standard edition and $100 Whiteout Edition--that both include a selection of collectibles. We've rounded up the full details on both versions below, along with links to preorder.

Frostpunk 2: Whiteout Edition

$100 | Releases September 18

If you want to load up on Frostpunk 2 collectibles, take a peek at the Whiteout Edition. It's a bit pricey at $100, but here's what you'll find inside:

  • Base game
  • Deluxe Edition upgrade
  • Digital artbook
  • Digital copy of Warm Flesh novella
  • New London pop-up diorama
  • 1 of 2 embroidered patches
  • 2 postcards
  • Keychain
  • Stickers
  • Multi-layered shadowbox

The Deluxe Edition upgrade is a big deal, as it entitles you to the first three DLC releases. Combined with all the physical goodies, there's a lot of content packed into this premium bundle.

Frostpunk 2 earned excellent reviews when it launched for PC last year. Our Frostpunk 2 review gave the PC release an 8/10, noting its complex systems that allow for intense experimentation and a unique mix of factions that make it both a political simulator and survival city-builder.

Frostpunk 2 PC Deals

If you're a PC player and want to play the game now, you can pick up Frostpunk 2 at a nice discount through Fanatical. The standard edition is available for $33.06 (was $45) while the Deluxe Edition--which includes a bath of DLC and exclusive digital content listed below--is down to $55.11 (was $75).

Frostpunk 2 Deluxe Edition (PC) content:

  • Frostpunk 2 base game
  • Three post-launch DLC expansions
  • Captain's Hall in-game item
  • Digital artbook
  • Digital soundtrack
  • Warm Flesh digital novella

Looking for another way to enjoy the unforgiving world of Frostpunk? Check out the Frostpunk Board Game. With support for one to four players, the strategy game has you guiding a small band of survivors to victory--which can be achieved in multiple ways. Whether you decide to be an evil leader terrorizing everyone you encounter or take a more tactical approach to survival, nothing is off the table. The challenging board game is seeing a $20 discount right now--and with games lasting around two hours, it's an excellent choice for an extended (and intense) game night.

Alternatively, console players can prep for Frostpunk 2 by diving into the original Frostpunk. You'll find it for $33 on both Xbox One and PS4, and while it's not strictly necessary to play Frostpunk before Frostpunk 2, you'll likely pick up small details in the sequel you'd otherwise miss. And if you're a fan of survival games and city builders, it should be more than enough to keep you busy until September 18.

item.title: The 2025 MacBook Air M4 Is Down To Its Lowest Price Yet
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

IF you've been waiting to grab the 2025 MacBook Air M4, now is the time, as it's down to its lowest price ever at just $799 (was $999) at Amazon. Released in March, this is the latest edition of the popular MacBook Air--and at this new low price, it's easier to recommend than usual. Anyone seeking a portable, powerful, and reliable laptop will find it to check all the right boxes, although it's unclear how long the discount will last. Apple products don't often see price cuts this big, so be sure to check this out while you can.

2025 MacBook Air (13-Inch, M4)

$799 (was $999)

Equipped with 16GB memory, 256GB SSD, and the powerful M4 chip, this version of the MacBook Air is an excellent choice for a young professional, student, or as the central computing hub for your family to stream videos, surf the web, or send emails. It'll also get up to 18 hours of battery life, so if you plan to travel with the laptop, you won't have to constantly be on the lookout for electrical outlets. This deal applies to all four colors of the 2025 MacBook Air M4.

A 13.6-inch Liquid Retina display makes all your videos, pictures, and games look fantastic, while a 12MP camera lets you dive into video chats or virtual lectures. Rounding out the rig are two Thunderbolt 4 ports, a MagSafe charging port, a headphone jack, support for Wi-Fi 6E, and the ability to connect to two external displays.

Not sold on this configuration? Two other versions are up for grabs--both of which are seeing a $200 price cut.

  • 16GB Memory + 256GB SSD -- $799 ($999)
  • 16GB Memory + 512GB SSD -- $999 ($1,199)
  • 24GB Memory + 512GB SSD -- $1,199 ($1,399)

2025 MacBook Air (15-Inch, M4)

$999 (was $1,199)

Need more screen space? The 15-Inch model is also seeing a $200 discount. Like the above 13-Inch model, this is the best price we've seen since it released in March. Just about everything is the same on this version of the MacBook Air, though you'll obviously benefit from a sizable 15.3-inch screen that's more conducive to gaming and streaming videos. Beyond that, you're still getting 18 hours of battery life, a Liquid Retina display, support for Wi-Fi 6E, two Thunderbolt 4 ports, and the powerful M4 chip for demanding tasks.

  • 16GB Memory + 256GB SSD -- $999 ($1,199)
  • 16GB Memory + 512GB SSD -- $1,199 ($1,399)
  • 24GB Memory + 512GB SSD -- $1,399 ($1,599)

If you're looking for a Windows laptop under $1,000 that's good for gaming, the Asus TUF Gaming F16 Laptop is currently on sale for $892.49 (was $1,100). This is (once again) the lowest price ever for the laptop, which gets you a 16-inch display, 144Hz refresh rate, RTX 4050, 16GB DDR5 RAM, and 512GB SSD. It's not nearly as portable as the slim and sleek MacBook Air, but if you're seeking a beefy rig for gaming, it's worth comparing the products to see which is best for your needs.

item.title: Xbox PC App Now Lets You Stream Your Own Games, Including Console Exclusives
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Xbox has expanded its game streaming perk for Game Pass Ultimate subscribers. Starting today, July 28, players can now stream their Xbox library to their PCs directly through the Xbox PC app.

In recent years, Microsoft has added the ability to stream your Xbox library to many devices, including Xbox consoles, smart TVs, and browsers. It announced today that this functionality has finally been added to the Xbox app on PC, meaning that most Xbox-related functionality should now be available in the app.

Streaming Xbox games isn't just a neat way to access your Game Pass library when you're away from your console or home PC. It also lets PC-only players access Xbox console exclusives that haven't made their way to PC yet.

Microsoft has also rolled out a bunch of other upgrades for the Xbox PC app. These are highlighted by efforts to consolidate and streamline the cloud gaming process. The app surfaces cross-device play history, meaning that you can start playing a game on Xbox and pick up your progress via game streaming in the app. The app update also adds a more cohesive game library, combining all games available to stream across consoles, including both purchased games and those available via Game Pass. Both of these changes are currently available for members of the Xbox Insider program, which is free to join and open for everyone.

Finally, the Xbox PC app now has an easier way to track Microsoft Rewards. Microsoft states that the new system will surface Rewards progress as you play, allowing you to track points across play sessions.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton Is Very Hyped For GTA 6
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

F1 star Lewis Hamilton is just like many gamers in that he's very excited for GTA 6. Speaking to fans recently, Hamilton listed off some of his favorite games, going on to single out GTA 6 as a game that he's so amped for that he's planning to "cancel all my work" when it releases.

"I'm a big gamer. I play a lot of Call of Duty, for sure... but I like Assassinâ€™s Creed, Gran Turismo," he said. "I'm dying for the new Grand Theft Auto to come out. GTA 6! Yeah, that's the one I'm waiting for. I'll have to cancel all my work when that game comes out."

As Dexerto points out, there is a small break in the 2026 F1 schedule around the time that GTA 6 launches on May 26, 2026, so that might work out nicely for Hamilton.

GTA 6 was originally set to be released in Fall 2025 before Rockstar Games delayed it to May 2026 to help give it more polish.

"In this case there was an opportunity with a small amount of incremental time, we thought, to make sure Rockstar Games achieves its creative vision with no limitations. And I supported of course that approach," Take-Two boss Strauss Zelnick said. "While of course, delays pain me--how could they not?--the most important thing to do is to support your teams in their search for perfection."

GTA 6 will hit PS5 and Xbox Series X|S on May 26, 2026. A PC version is expected to be released at a later date.
